newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bremen coffee prices rise in line with futures.
newsitem.headline: Bremen coffee prices rise in line with futures.

text.p: Arabica prices in the Bremen coffee market jumped $8-10 on the week per 50 kg fob in line with futures gains, traders reported.
Interest in outright purchases and price fixings focused on May-August but sellers for those dates were scarce.
Sellers instead were looking to take advantage of the New York March and May arabica premiums over the more distant months and were trying to place spot coffees.
Brazilian and Kenyan differentials eased while Colombians and Central Americans firmed. Second hand coffees in Europe were sought after but supplies were limited.
